ygData.subject: Re: Stun issue
ygData.msgSnippet: There is someone in Qeynos that sells a silk evening tunic that increases charisma for about 1pp (Middle of the open area as you come out from the bank,
ygData.messageBody:
There is someone in Qeynos that sells a silk evening tunic that increases
charisma for about 1pp

(Middle of the open area as you come out from the bank, heading for the
gates to the city, The lady that sells cloth aror)

On Wed, 8 Sep 1999, Slithey Tove wrote:

> From: "Slithey Tove" <slithey@...>
>
> The dress idea is interesting. There is an item indexed on EQ'izer called a
> 'black silk evening tunic'. It increases your charisma, but isn't very good
> armor. ^_^ Forget where it comes from. Anyone seen anyone wearing one? What
> does it look like? Is it strapless?
>
> For that matter, it might be interesting to go bar-hopping in a tux, my
> being a male, and all.
>
> But wait. We're clerics. Shouldn't we be able to wear vestments on special
> occasions? Now that would be cool.
>
> == Gilead, dwarven cleric of Fennin Ro
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Talbot, Judy <jtalbot@...>
> To: 'EQ-clerics@onelist.com' <EQ-clerics@onelist.com>
> Date: Tuesday, September 07, 1999 9:22 AM
> Subject: [EQ-Clerics] Stun issue
>
>
> >From: "Talbot, Judy " <jtalbot@...>
> >
> > I agree with Twylork and Heather about the stun issue, there is nothing so
> >frustrating as trying to flee a train, having divine aura on and then being
> >all twisted around in the opposite direction of where you were going
> because
> >the enemy stunned you. What makes it worse is the spell has a small
> duration
> >and it takes valuable seconds to get yourself pointed back in the right
> >direction. Oh well, one can only hope that if enough p
> >eople complain EQ designers will adjust it.
> >Also I would like to get your opinions on the fashion issue. What do you
> >think of the women of Norrath being able to attend an event, such as a
> >wedding in a dress. There also should a gathering place in Qeynos where an
> >event could take place without being attacked by beasts, or the guys could
> >really become Knights in Shining Armor by protecting all the fair damsels
> of
> >Norrath. Again an item for my wish list as I sometimes get tired of wearing
> >my full battle dress all the time. Healingsun, Solusek Ro. Level 15 cleric
>
>
>

My picture of the world is of masses of people extending gifts to other
people, doing favors -- but nobody keeping score. -- Dr. Whitsett
